page.title: 02PONTSTICILL SINCE 1800
page.content: In the early 1800's the Pontsticill area was an important agriculutral region, it played a very important part in supplying food for the industrial town of Merthyr Tydfil. In the last century the most important member of the community was the farmer.It was his job to provide food for the surrounding areas. To provide the farmer with what he wanted there were other tradesmen,such as the shoemaker,the itinerant cloggers who would make clogs from the alder trees, the fuller used the farmers wool to make cloth for clothes. After the Pentwyn reservoir was built in the 1860's many people travelled from Dowlais and Merthyr to Pontsticill to attend summer fairs and fetes,with over 6000 people present on a single day,some of whom even sailed on the lake steamer built in 1865.
